item.title: [[Deep Learning]] For NLP
item.description: [[Deep Learning]] For NLP Lots of progress recently People trust [[Wikipedia]], [[Google Translate]], etc. more than other people, in some cases Language models assign probability to text $p(x_0, …, x_n)$ Most popular method is to factorize distribution using chain rule: $$p(x_0,…x_n) = p(x_0)p(x_1 \mid x_0) \cdots p(x_n \mid x_{n-1})$$ Neural Language Models [[Convolutional Language Models]] (CLMs) Earliest

item.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
item.description: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models Larger models are significantly more sample-efficient, such that optimally compute-efficient training involves training very large models on a relatively modest amount of data and stopping significantly before convergence.
